title: Sidewall, "Sacred to Washington", ca. 1800
provenance: From a house in Sandsfield (near Otis), Massachusetts.
creditline: Gift of the children of the late Edith Parsons Morgan
description: Pillar and arch design. Rounded arch flanked by corinthian columns supporting ornate architrave. In opening, a fenced-in altar with inscription "Sacred to Washington", surmounted by urn and eagle, and flanked by mourning figures of Liberty and Justice; in front, arms, drum and flags. Originally blue, now gray and black.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sidewall, "Sacred to Washington", ca. 1800.
ca. 1800. Block-printed on handmade paper. Gift of the children of the late Edith Parsons Morgan. 1960-103-1-a/i.
